Question: In 1953 they had another falling-out during this person's ill-fated tour with Louis Armstrong, which was produced by John Hammond.
Hints: Vocalists Anita O'Day and Helen Forrest spoke bitterly of their experiences singing with this person.
His father was David **** (1873-1926), a tailor from Warsaw; his mother was Dora Grisinsky (1873-1964) from Kaunas, Lithuania.
When **** finished his solo, he unexpectedly gave a solo to pianist Jess Stacy.
